text: Keg at Armsby Abbey. Murky orange, large creamy white head, good retention. Aroma of pine, grapefruit, lemongrass, pale malt. Taste is grapefruit, pine, pale malt. Medium bodied, well balanced, lingering bitterness.
Draft: Poured a hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is mixed hops aroma. Taste is subtle at first with a nice bite.

On tap at hill farmstead. Pours out a hazy golden topped with a white head. Nose is lots of citrus notes tangerines orange some sweetness. Taste is more of the nice citrus mix tangerine sweetness with some orange peel zest.

Reviewed from notes.
On tap at the Blackback, Waterbury, VT.
They poured this into a tulip.
The appearance was a glossy/hazy burnt dark orange color. Thin white head. Sly amount of lacing.
The smell started off with thick juicy to bitter orange juice to pulp. Sweetly dosed with some grapefruit pulp and rind.
The flavor brings it all together for a spectacular bittersweet balance. Gentle juicy to the touch in the aftertaste. Slick sweet finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation seems to feel good, fairly low. Smooth coat of juice slides across my tongue. Some bitterness.
Overall, damn nice APA that I would love to have again.
Tap at black back. Pours clear orange some head and some lacing. Nose is fruity and grapefruit. Flvours of grapefruit, orange, cereal. Taste med bitter light sweet. Med body lively carbonation.

Growler. Piurs cloudy orange with a White head. Aroma of very tropical, citra bursting, light sweet, grape, pineapple, clean, smooth mango flavors. Taste is tropical, sweet, mango. Dry and bitter finish. Just waow.

Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a soapy white head and light lacing .... Aroma of citra hops lemony and grapefruits .... Taste is of citra hops nice lemony flavor tart and a bit dry rindy grapefruit .... Nicely dry hopped with a light biscuity malt backbone .... Finish is crisp and dry with a lingering bitter hop bite which is subtle ..... Solid sessionable pale ale and you cant go wrong with citra.... Nice sample of single hop
Pours a hazy pale yellow and orange. The aroma is tangerine, orange, Papaya.

Sample at the brewery. Restraint in a glass. Despite brewing with a pretty pungent hop that Ive seen a lot of brewers use to make a hop bomb, Hill Farmstead have gone the opposite way with this one and made a very dry, balanced pale ale. Strong and pleasant aroma, but I found the actual taste to be a bit one-dimensional and fleeting. Somewhat boring compared to everything else on tap.

Light gold pour with some lingering white head. Smells very citrus-forward. Flavor has a lots of oranges and grapefruit it in. Really nice. Really drinkable. ABV is low enough that I could drink this like orange juice.
Pale yellow but hazy or opaque pour. Splashy and messy look and smells/tastes the same. Loads of citrusy hops. Not a hop monster but fresh as hell. Could drink lots of these suckers.

Tap. Prohibition Pig, Waterbury, VT. Opaque gold. Thin, clingy, white head. Nose is big, full, juicy fresh citrus. Background of biscuit malts. Taste is a beautiful balance of the two. Clean and easy drinking. Perfect fizz. Juicy bitter finish. Extra marks for the lemon and lime hop burps! Fantastic pale ale.

Draft at Blackback Pub. Pours a hazy deep yellow light orange color with an off white head. Aroma packs a wonderful citrus and tropical fruit to it, but a touch more mild than the Double Citra, as to be expected. A bit more crushable given the lower ABV. Outstanding beer!
Fat på tørst brooklyn, nyc. Disig gul kulör. Mycket fruktig doft. Framförallt citron och stall. I smak mycket citrus och blött gräs
Fat på törst. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Väldigt fruktig doft med ananas och passionsfrukt. Lätt i smaken med fräsch fruktighet.
Draft. Aromas of orange juice and some grapefruit. Flavors are mostly grapefruit with some shortbready crackerish malt presence. Fizzy mouthfeel. Good, but nothing to justify a 100 here.

Growler received in trade. Pours very hazy brunt deep yellow with a rather small frothy white head that leaves lots of sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is heavy fruity and slightly grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, passion fruit, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon balm, kumquats and lemon zest. Slightly bitter, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, tiny crisp, dry, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with crackers, white bread, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, lychee, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemon balm, lemon grass and lemon zest. Holy mother of Citra!! Huge high quality hops on that magical Hill Farmstead pale ale base. Great amazing stuff as Ive learned to expect from my favourite brewer.
Juicy mango, guava, peach, white grape, grass, grainy/biscuity/crackery mild sweetness. Best pale Ive ever had maybe?
I wasnt sure of all the hype but the brewery pulled through. A very well balanced beer that had a great hop palate and no overwhelming alcohol.
Tap. Hazy yellow white pour with a nice white head. Citrus, pine, grapefruit, hop. Very well balanced. Smooth medium body and carbonation. Seems bigger and much flavorful than a 5.5%. Really nice

750 mL growler poured into an Allagash chalice.
Hazy orange with a nice white head. Sticky lacing. Great retention.
 Oh my. Citrus hop all the way. Smells like a really well hopped IPA. Tropical fruits and citrus. Just a hint of grainy malt shines through.
Taste is more focused on orange citrus, but still retains some tropical fruit flavors. No sweetness, grainy malts give the only bit of backbone it has. Almost no bitterness.
 Medium carbonation, maybe a little low from the growler. Light body. Drinkable as hell.
Hill Farmstead has set the standard on pale ales with this one.

750ml growler pous hazy dark orange with 2 finger head. Nose is juicy dank orange peel, some pine, citrus and melon. Taste is similar, bursting with juicy orange, grapefruit, some bitter piney cracker malt, dry. Finishes with linger bittery sticky citus, orange juice and pith, light malt. Fantastic.

Growler, keg at the brewery. Thanks to Ryan for the pour. 

This really is the American equivalent of Oakham Citra for me. Super clean and well-made, juicy and dank. No ott raw onion. Gorgeous image. Can look at ti all day long. Just would prefer it to be a bit more aggressive on the hops.

On tap at Magnaball, thanks so much, Shaun, for sending so many delicious kegs! Pours lemon deeper yellow. The Citra hops shines so well on the nose and in flavor, especially on a hot summer day! The Citra has such balanced citrus flavors and no hop bite with perfectly balanced body. This beer outshined all the others at the festival (even the other Vermont beers!!).

Dégustée sur la terrasse en compagnie de Marco en ce midi ensoleillé. Shaun, merci! Magnifique liquide - comme toujours qui se dévoile à nous arborant une robe orange écarlate, bien voilée et pleine de personnalité. La mousse formée de grosses bulles blanches et vives dessine une fresque singulière sur mon verre avec la grâce dune bière impériale. Houblons verts, échalotes sèches et gazon. Le festival de fraîcheur se poursuit en bouche avec maintenant une touche terreuse qui rappelle la carotte ou le navet grâce à cette amertume qui me rappelle autant la salade jardinière que le cucurbitacée. Tranchante, sans arrière-goût, corps mince, ni malté ni sucré, il ne serait que trop facile de déguster cette bière jusquà ce que Mort sen suive.

750ml growler from the brewery. Aroma: loads of citrus and tropical fruits. Piney. App: hazy pale almost golden with medium white creamy head. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous, soft carbonation, crisp dry bitter finish. Overall: oh God! Thats awesome! Taste could be a bit better, more fruity but besides from that, this is great.

Glass, 16-ounce, draught, trip to Dark Lord Day with Luc Bourbonnière, savoured on April 25 2015; eye: yellowish, hazy, tiny ring of off-white head; nose: hops, pine, grapefruit, tangerine; mouth: hops, pine, grapefruit, tangerine, dry finale in grapefruit, full body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, lightly harsh texture ; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 16 onces, en fût, cadeau de Adam Conway, durant Dark Lord Day, voyage avec Luc Bourbonnière, savourée le 25 avril 2015; il : jaunâtre, voilée, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé; nez : houblon, pin, pamplemousse, tangerine; bouche : houblon, pin, pamplemousse, tangerine, finale sèche en pamplemousse, corsée, bonne carbonatation, moyennement amère, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien bon
Growler at Bills. Pours a beautiful hazy golden yellow with thin white lacing. Mouthfeel is bone dry with notes of bitter citrus and super fresh grass. Sour grapefruit. Straight forward but great.

Growler from Hill farmstead. At this particular time, they had several citra focused beer available. It was almost a disservice to this delicious beer. Big citra nose, tropical fruit, peach, white grape. Excellent medium bodied beer with light carbonation. Great stuff
Pale hazy yellow pour with a white head. Poured from a 750 growler. Nice citra nose. Big citrus hop taste grapefruit and tangerine.

Tap. Pours quite hazy golden, large creamy white head, nice lacing. Aroma is light dank tropical, passionfruit, a bit of cat piss. Flavor is dry, light plus bitter, fruity, some pine. Light body. Soft mouthfeel.
Taster at the source pours hazy yellow with thin white head. Aromas of fresh citrus and hints of pine. Taste is slightly dry with a nice tropical finish.
Had from guest taps at DLD 2015. Complex in the fact that I get lots of hop flavor, but can almost taste the malts as if I were chewing on the grains themselves. Awesome.

Tap at Hill Farmstead. Light yellow hazed color. White head. Intense aromas of sweet citrus juice. Flavor is gently bitter and semi dry. Probably the best expression of juicy tropical hops Ive ever had. Dry tropical finish. Mind blowing. Downright amazing. Im not sure how he pulls this amount of flavor and expression out of a 5% beer.
Growler, big citrus and fruity aroma, taste is less complex and more bitter than the mosaic, but still a great pale

5/III/15 - 75cl growler @ Drunken Drivers tasting (home) - BB: n/a, filled: 3/III/15 (2015-262) Thanks to AdamJackson for sharing the bottle!
Clear bright yellowish beer, creamy white to off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: citrus, floral, some grapefruit. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity, citrus, little sweet, nice bitterness, pretty soft hoppy notes, malty grains, little spicy. Aftertaste: bitter, citrus, bit grassy, nice hoppy flavour, good stuff!!
Sample, from tderoeck. Many thanks! Hazy yellow colour. Soft carbonation. Very bitter and dry. Hoppy aftertaste. Very well balanced. Good!

Bottle 0.75l from tderoeck at Train direction Vichte to Alvinne Craft Beer Festival 2015. Thank you very much Tim for giving us homework :-).Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head.On the nose tangerine. Taste and aroma of orange, tangerine, exotic fruits, orange peels and very fresh hops.Very good balanced I liked it very much.

Bottle, shared by tderoeck on a train Ghent-Vichte direction ACBF (Belgium). Thank you Tim. Pours a bright golden color, hazy with some bubbles instead of the foam. Nose: tangerine, orange, flowers. Mouth: very balanced bitter palate, a fresh bottle definitely, malty enough and so thirst-quenching. Citrus all around.

This poured a hazy golden yellow.color with a white head. Aroma was big citra hops, sharp tropical notes, mildly grassy too. Flavor similar, like.zombie dust but way softer and not and.tongue crushing. Oh so good.

Growler. The pour is a pale murky orangish. The aroma is all hops, strong. The taste is super hoppy, piney. A slight bitter on the end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can at Drunken Drivers Tasting @ tderoecks place. Thanks guys. THanks alot Adam for driving to Hill Farmstead especially for us. Cloduy pale yellow, 2-day old growler. Explosion of fruit, honey, citrus, very maty backbone. Very very nice.

Belle couleur dorée avec un col blanc assez résistant. Arome de fruits tropicaux, céréales, un peu de résines. Très très raffraichissant, très bien balancé. Excellente Pale ale, une des meilleures que jai gouté a Hillfarmstead!
Growler. Color is murky light orange with perfect head. Aroma of yummy citrus with floral aroma. Taste is very floral lots of citrus clean.

Growler. Pours murky yellow with thin white head that lingers. Light carbonation over grapefruit aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler thanks to Kirk. Appearance is hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is loaded with citrus, hints of peach and some pineapple. Taste is light citrus, followed by some hop bite, crisp clean finish. Great balance, nice mouthfeel, very quaffable, excellent.
Growler from the brewery. Pours a cloudy pale orange with a white head. Citrusy juicy aroma. Slight grain in the aroma. Taste is balanced. Light bitterness. Crushable.
Draft. Cloudy grapefruit juice. Tons of citrus and pineapple. Some leafy hops and pine too. Medium mouthfeel and carb. Very good.

Growler. Cloudy yellow. Big orange juice citrusy aroma. Sweet. Light tartness. Crisp. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at HF. Poured hazy yellow orange with white head. Juicy orange citrus aroma. Light carb med bod. Tastes a lil dank sweet bitter dry

Growler brought from the source by lunch, thanks Paul! Pours a hazy orange color, with lasting white and solid lacing. Aroma is bitter hops and citrus sweetness. Flavor is same with medium body, bright carbonation and sweet Citra character in the finish. Amazing.

Purchased growler refill at brewery. Poured with foamy head that quickly dissipated. Aroma of citrus and pine/spruce. Certainly taste the citrus - more on the grapefruit. Has a medium body with average carbonation and a bitter finish. Only wish I was drinking this in the spring or summer rather than early January.
Draught at MikkellerBar. Cloudy golden - white head. Citra. Ok bitterness. Light to medium malty. High fruity. Lovely freshness. A bit simple - but nice.

October 10, 2014. On tap at M&F. 
Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruit, mango, peach, mandarin. Taste is light to medium sweet tropical fruits, medium bitter with some pine and citrus zest notes. Finish is tropical fruit sweetness and medium rounded bitterness. Light to medium bodidd, creamy texture, average carbonation.

Growler thanks to WillRunForBeer. Shared at my house. Hazy yellow pour with a small foamy head that fades to a thin ring. Big, dank, juicy aroma of pineapples, grapefruit, and light grass. Taste is an excellent blend of tropical fruit and citrus with some very light grass. Ultra crisp. Medium body. So easy to drink. Delicious.

Growler: Thanks, Jason. Cloudy, bright sunshine gold color with a slightly soapy head that skims to a collar quickly, some webbed lacing along the glass. Aroma is super juicy, tons of citrus, Orange Julius, light pineapple rind & some sticky grapefruit fresh with an underbelly of wet grass, faint green onion, & light white peppery herbalness. Insanely crisp, fresh flavor with everyone in the aroma translating beautifully. Crisp grassy notes, light herbal pines, grapefruit peel, orange, mild pineapple, tons of semi-bitter citrus with a faint crackery pale malt base, just stable enough to provide a small backbone. Crisp, dry finish leaving some citrus rind on the palate. Delicious.

This growler is a few days past "expiration" due to a shipping issue, but feels to be in fine shape; thank you Andrew. Typically perfect HF pour; juicy, clouded tangerine orange topped with fluffy, fine-bubbled white. Guava and pineapple in the initial tropical wave; seared citrus rinds and sunflower seeds fill in the cracks as the initially stunning sunshine grays a little. Salty baguette malt and ample mineral character suggest the high quality of this independent of the hop layering.

Flavor bursts with fresh clementine, lime zest, Meyer lemon and guava, while a delicate grassy sweetness softens those bright colors. Salty, earthy lemon pepper and a mild zucchini like pungency may suggest the beginning of the decline; Shauns pale ales are generally near perfection, but even a few extra days seems to upset the tightrope-like balance somewhat.

The palate is still gorgeous and not improvable. Pillowy and full, cottony, with amply crisp carbonation; finish flashes juiciness and then succinctly vanishes. The high fruity acids are still vibrant, and while vegetal leafiness and seedy bitterness are distantly present, this is polished and on the mark, as always. 

If Shaun used this template for a noble hopped pale ale it would surely be close to a perfect beer for me.

Citrus fruity hoppy and malty aroma and taste, some light caramel, mandarin lemon, straw, some grassy nuance, refreshing, hoppy bitter finish. Gorgeous.

Bottle. Pours like lemonade-very cloudy yellow with a creamy to frothy lasting white head that leaves excellent lacing. Rich aroma of sweet floral tropical citrus, grass, grapefruit and orange and pine. Lightly sweet and lightly bitter, light to medium body, flavors of grapefruit, lime, extremely drinkable session beer, average carbonation and a long bitter finish. Wow!

On tap at Pro Pig: Pours golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma is a complete citrus dream, lots of orange, lemon, and even some slight pineapple notes. Taste is orange peel, slight pine, and fairly bitter. Light to medium body, tons of flavor, a very nice single hop beer.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy yellow/orange with a white head. Aroma of wick wickedy wick wack citrusy citra hops, some tropical fruits like mandarin, tangerine and pineapple - and some pine in the back as well. Really clean and mouthwatering aroma. Taste is fresh and bitter with citra all over the place. I get a lot of blood orange, pine and just citrus fruits all over. Really good if you like this hop variety!

On tap at Hill Farmstead tap takeover, Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade October 10th. Pours a murky yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of citrus, peach, apricot mango and passion fruit. Taste is very much the same - mango, peach, passion fruit and grapefruit with a slight acidic touch. Mouthfeel is fairly smooth and medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus and weak peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is spicy, grapefruit and apricot. Semi-sweet flavour with medium bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Nice, well balanced and very drinkable.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Smell of citra hops, which gives a citrus and very fresh smell. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Taste has a lot of hops for an APA and some fruits. Palate is thin and easy - as expected. Overall a enjoyable and nice beer. The freshness of citra hops really does its job.

On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours a mostly clear amber with medium, off-white head that leaves plenty of film and lace. Decent regeneration that does seem to fade somewhat. Aroma is pungent cats pee citra hops with notes of tropical fruit. Oily texture, medium carbonation, medium body and a lingering, balanced finish with bitter notes but with a malt backbone. Flavour is balanced with notes of tropical fruit juice sweetness but well balanced against the hops. Quite drinkable but I think I prefer Edward.

Tap. Hazy golden body with a small, lacing and beige head. Aroma of citrus, peach, apricot, caramel and some spicy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice APA.

Draught @ Mikkeller. Golden coloured. Hazy. Small off White head. Aroma. Citrus. Tropical fruits. Flowers. Flavour. Tropical fruits, sweetness, flowers, herbs, citrus. Medium to full bodied. Ends citric and flowery bitter.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Hazy, golden-amber with a thin, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, pale malts, sweet exotic fruits. Taste is bitter. Medium body, creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes lasting dry and bitter with citrus and fruits. Lovely APA,
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of grassy and citrusy hops. Dry and hoppy flavour with herbal and grassy notes. Long dry hopping? Old beer? Citra shouldnt taste like this...
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of LeMond, petroleum, and hops. The flavor is sweet with petroleum. Malt, spice, and lemons, leading to a bitter finish.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavor of hops and citrus peel with notes of pine needles.
Hoppy finish.

Pours hazy pale yellow with low white head. Aroma of mango, peach, apricot, citrus, passion fruit. Taste is fresh, fruity bitter, slight tart and funk with distinct grapefruit. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation. Lingering mellow bitter finish.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Peachy and citrusy hoppy. Smooth fruity snd citrusy hoppy. Crisp fruity finish.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden orange color with white head. Grapefruit, orange, citrus hop aromas. Grapefruit, passion fruit, slight resin flavors. Nice body, nice balance, nice citra flavor.

Growler @ home, big thanks to Lukaduke for sending! Shared with jcnielsen for the Michigan State/Nebraska game. Pours a cloudy light yellow orange appearance with a frothy white head. Herbal, dank, lightly resiny hops in the nose with a ton of citrus - grapefruit, tangerine, mango. Medium light bodied. A little doughy/chewy mouthfeel. Low bitterness. Low sweetness. Juicy orange, doughy flavor. A touch of onion and spicy hops. Super chuggable.
Growler - pour cloudy golden/yellow. Oranges, tangerines, and lemon zest in the nose. Nice hoppy/bitterness up front with oranges and tangerines. Very well balanced. A solid beer!

Aroma: Mild Onions, Mildly Grapefruit, Mildly Malty

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Thick White Head, Great Lacing

Taste: Mild Onions, Mildly Malty

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

750 mL growler. Pours an extremely turbid apricot, the classic fluffy HF head. Nose holds gorgeous scallion, lemon rind, white grapefruit, bark mulch, hot wet grass, garlic; lovely. Flavor is softer, with citrus becoming more pronounced, but that lovely dank character still providing backbone. Perfect, clean, crisp and dry palate. I actually think Citra is an overrated hop in terms of its usual character, but sweet lord is this outstanding. Thanks to Shaun, Bob, Phil, and all of the crew!

750mL growler, sent from my sugar daddy, pours a cloudy pale golden with a medium white head. Nose is classic Hill Farmstead, with loads of fresh floral hops, fresh meadows, and pine -- wonderful aromatics. Flavour is exactly the same, with a fresh bouquet of floral hops, some pine, and the unmistakeable "cat piss" quality from the citra. Dry as can be, with a very pleasant astringency on the finish. Another wonderful (I)PA from the masters.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2016 Pours a hazy light golden with a medium white head that leaves superior lacing. Nose is of citrus, tropical fruits and fresh cereals. Taste is of tropical fruits, light flour with a moderately high bitterness. Some perfumey mangoes. Body is light, carbonation medium-high. Overall a really nice hoppy offering by HFS again!

750 ml fill bottle purchase at the brewery on August 21, 2014. Murky yellow cream, little head. Fresh Citra hop aroma, very juicy. Juicy citrus hop taste, somewhat dry, good dry bitterness. Thats how you respect the Citra hop!
Hazy yellow pour, a thumbs worth of head. Grapefruit, citrus zest and peels. and mildly dank in both aroma and taste. Slick oily mouthfeel. Went back for another pint

On tap at the brewery. Cloudy yellow pour with a big white head. Enticing grapefruit hop bouquet. The taste follows suit with the perfect amount of hoppy bitterness. Perfect balance with a big bold flavor profile. Good body.

Pours a softly pale lemon yellow with a hazy little blush inside. A creamy head of white foam that fell slowly and left good lace. Nose is bright lemon peel. As it warms some tropical mango and beautiful floral come forward. Light and flaky biscuit, with a drizzle of honey. Floral and sweet herbal back notes. Taste is lovely and even delicate. This beer has a superb mouthfeel. Its got a just a little breaddiness, just a bit of flaky sweet biscuit to make the mouthfeel creamy and give it depth. The hops are floral and lemony. The bright lemon peel with the citric tartness lightly underneath. The tropical softer stone fruits in this are permeating the drink for a juicy and ripe taste. There is a moderate but very soft bitter that is just one of the best bitters I have ever had.

Light easy to drink and very flavorful. This beer will be an instant favorite.

Pours hazy blond, minimal head

Smell fruity flowery, citra

Taste zesty hoppy, bit oily

Light and bitter 

Nice
Blonde. Beau collet blanc et dense. Très fruité. Céréale/foin. Bien houblonné. Citronné. Agrume. Fruit tropicaux. Très sèche et désaltérante. Sublime.

Growler thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy yellow with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is a strong citra, fruit, pine. Thick mouthfeel with light dry hop, citrus, pine, and nice dry finish. Very good.

Growler trade from kfarrell7, thanks a bunch. Unclear dark yellow body with a medium off white head aroma is fantastic, lots of citrus fruit like oranges, lemon, grapefruit. Clean hops. Flavor is hops, fruit, citric, grapefruit, grassy notes. This is beerporn.
En fût. Excellente bière. Arôme d'agrumes. Moyenne amertume. Rafraichissante.

Growler 750ml. Couleur jaune-orangée trouble, mousse blanche laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme de mandarine, citron, zeste de citron. Goût dagrumes, malt pâle, pulpe de citron, amertume moyenne, légère acidité en fin de bouche. Carbonatation moyenne-faible, corps moyen, texture ample.
Draft. Light yellow with white head. For a pale ale this seems very freshly hopped, citra tones. Flavor is fresh, citrus, grassy hop flavors. Nice apa.

On tap at Prohibition Pig, Waterbury, Vermont. Cloudy peach. Fruity aroma. Taste is very easy going - nice drinker; hops, mild fruit, good bitterness. Citra hop is still not a favourite of mine, but this is a good single hopped pale.

Growler shared by a kind soul at the Pre-Hunahpu Thursday Tasting. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is big citra hop notes: tropical fruit, pine, and lots of citrus. Flavor is similar- nice pale ale malt backbone with tropical fruit hops, citrus, and pine. Really nice pale.
Orange/gold pour, white head. Juicy citrusy hops abound! Perfectly hoppy and just incredibly drinkable. Very enjoyable.

Growler shared at our going away party. Pours a hazy golden orange with big white head. Aroma of robust citrus and grass. Taste is loads of citra and citrus flavor. Slightly less in the mouthfeel. Nice.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Growler partagé lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de pamplemousse avec une pointe de mangue et dananas. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dorange et de citron avec une pointe de fruits tropicaux. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de citron en arrière goût. (Rating #4951)

Taster at the source. Pours pale yellow gold with a frothy lingering white head. Aroma is lemon, mango. Taste is quite lemony, but not overly sour, with some mango and a touch of grapefruit peel in the finish.

A: Very hazy golden-orange color, nice foamy white head. Carbonation looks to be lacking a bit. Nice lacing.

S: Love these all citra beers, reminds me a ton of Citra Ninja, Zombie Dust, etc. Huge punch of candied fruits, mango, grapefruit, pineapple, touch of honey, and some pine.

T: Flavor is much more subdued then the aroma. Some citrus, mango and pine. Clean, crisp and refreshing. Just wish it punched you in the mouth just as much as it did in the aroma. Nice light malt background as well.

M: Pretty light, light carbonation. Crisp and not that much residual sugar, which is a plus.

O: Amazing citra aroma that punches you in the nose, but with this had more flavor and bitterness to it. It is really easy to drink though and would love to try this again he there are adjustments.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Nailed it, as always. Citrus bomb in the nose... Some lemon. Sharp flavors, grapefruit, grass, dandelion, orange and lemon zest... Such balance all around, mouthfeel exactly as it should be, wish it lasted all day.

[5264-20130426] Tap. Fragrant orange hops aroma. Hazy, light orange body with a medium-lasting creamy off-white head. Orange citrus hops flavour is mildly bitter. Medium body has a nice relaxed bitterness that grows cumulatively. Delicious, very drinkable. (8/4/9/4/16) 4.1
(@ Prohibition Pig, Waterbury, VT)

If you love Heady Topper, youll go bonkers for this one. Except if youre not lucky enough to live in Vermont, you might not be able to try either of these. So clean & tingly on the tongue, big head dissipates quickly, refreshing as all get out. Im convinced this brewery will remain at the top of the charts for years to come.

My Bottom Line:
Citrus fruit and sandy resins leap from this brews svelte pale malts, yielding yet another compelling Hill Farmstead IPA experience.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam laces atop the misty pale blond.
-Amazingly, the cat litter aroma often found in Citra IPAs is not found here.
-The finish is resinous and moderately bitter.
-The aroma on this one is mesmerizing.

On tap at the brewery.

Bottle share 2012 (old review). Hazy amber with a averaged sized white head. Aroma and flavor is huge fresh hops. Notes of citrus, tropical fruits, and grapefruit. Some light biscuit/bread in the finish.
no bullshit inane bloviation could add anything else to the discussion of descriptions of this beer.

A- 750ml growler from the brewery. Pours a translucent light golden color with an off white head that thins to a nice clingy skin. Lacing is decent. S- rich aromas of grapefruit, lemon peel, lemon pepper, orange, mango, and biscuits with butter. Resin, straw and soap support. Dandelions, faint tarragon and some spicy herbal notes sting the back of the nose. After a while a decadent peach shines through. M- mild oily body with a bitter and acidic palate. Good carbonation. T- begins with grapefruit and mango before moving on to the biscuit malts. Middle goes back to the citrus, soap and straw with some lingering resiny maltiness mixed in. Herbal and earthy notes mix with a bitter grapefruit and lemon on the long, crisp satisfying ending.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2014 Une bombe aromatique incomparable lorsque sortie directement du fût. Son corps est assez mince et le fini assez sec pour une buvabilité sans borne. Avec ses notes de mangue, pêche, tangerine, ananas et tout ce que le citra peut apporter, elle fait vraiment classe à part si on veut la classer pale ale.

Growler @ Richards tasting. Hazed golden pour with a white head. Really dank citrus aroma. Tons of grapefruit, orange, and tropical fruit. Biscuit malt, pine, peach, and mango. Flavor is really juicy and fruity. Grapefruit, orange, mango, and peach. A touch of pineapple, some biscuit, and a light bitterness on the finish.

Pours from growler a hazy golden color with a medium foamy white head that recedes slowly. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, hops and toasted malt. Light-bodied with flavors of citrusy hops, tropical fruit and malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a lingering hops and grapefruit aftertaste. Very good overall.

Nicely hoppy, yet citrus doesn't come through as much as I'd hope. Astringent up front, tasty yet relatively mild overall profile. Citra is my favorite hop, but I strongly prefer the multi-hopped HF brews.

Growler shared with GT2. Pours is full hazy peach. Aroma of orange blossom, honeysuckle, fresh peach. Fresh, somewhat mango tropical. Taste is unbaked fresh dough, soft bitterness, citrus juice. Dry, light grapefruit peel bitterness. Excellent.

750mL flip-top growler thanks to DoctorB2B on BA and Untappd. Pours a full haze, translucent glowing peach. Thicker, white foam with complete lacing. Nose is juicy kumquat, sweet cream butter, fresh biscuit, grapefruit marmalade. As it warms it gains an insanely juicy peach. Taste is a tad soapy, slightly harsher than expected. Dry, herbal, potpourri finish. Actually cleaner than a lot of other HF hoppy beers with a complete absence of their house characteristic "sweet cream butter" slickness. Here the palate is more aggressive, more grapefruit peel and perfume that comes across as more chemical as their other offerings, but more in line with aggressive hop bombs that it competes against. Still, no brewing flaws just slightly soapier than its peers in this series.

Growler shared by Aaron last night, thanks for the opportunity!
Cloudy murky straw color with a smallish sticky white head. Floral tropical citrus hop aromas in spades with a hint of bready malt if I squint a bit. Solid fruity and citrus hop flavor with a light to moderate level of bitterness. Light sweet bready malt is barely for show. Medium body with a light to moderate level of carbonation and a slick resinous mouthfeel. Great beer Im glad I got to try it!

Hazy bright orange color, thin white head. The usual burst of sweet mangoes, peaches, orange, and grapefruit. Fleeting sweetness is balanced with mild bitterness in the back. The perfect amount of carbonation. Very clean and crisp finish, making it quite refreshing.

Very good. Has an amazing nose. Citra gives off a great aroma. Pours cloudy blonde with some head and lacing. Finishes very bitter. Nice farmhouse taste as well with some hay. A good dose of pine as well. On tap at brewery.

On draft at brewery. Hazy yellow, white head. Strong citrus pine and nuts on nose and palate... Better than Zombie dust... Well done!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks Czar for sharing! This beer is beautifully crafted to enhance the flavours and aromas of Citra hops. It is just sweet enough to keep the bitterness tasteful. The aromas are clear and crisp: resin, citrus and a bit of sulfur.

Poured from growler to hill farmstead wine glass. Poured a straw yellow with a light foamy, almost soapy, white head. Smelled of lemon zest, hops, and slight basil. Tastes include citrus, light malt, mild spice with hops pleasantly throughout. I wish I couldve drank this all summer. Incredible.

From growler thx Czar.
Pours hazy blond with medium white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, fruits. Taste is of citrus, pine, fruits, slight bittereness. Palate: Light-medium body. Overall: Very nice hop action. Clean, fruity. Refreshing. Drinkable.
A hazed golden ale with a thick off white head. In aroma, biscuit malt with floral catty hops, pleasant and smooth. In mouth, a smooth citrusy hops with nice grassy malt, nice and smooth.

Draft @ Three Penny Taproom. Glowing hazy yellow color with thick frothy head. Nose is real interesting... Garlic, mango and grapefruit. The flavor is balanced perfect. Bread or dough malt with bright citrus flavors that relate directly to the aroma. Grapefruit, fresh cut grass, mango and onions. Really displays this Citra hop really nicely. The texture is dry with a very low bitterness. I really enjoy the low bitterness factor. Really great pale ale that can be enjoyed in large amounts.
Aroma of pine, floral hops, citrus, tropical fruit, toast, and resin. Taste was flowery, citrus fruits, pine, and grapefruit. Solid IPA.

Growler from the brewery. Man, when you crack it open the citrus aromas just come flooding out. Loads of dank grapefruit, melon and pineapple on the nose. Pours hazy, light gold with a strong, creamy white cap. Light sweet flavor with crisp, fairly dry pale malts, mild citrus pith, more juicy grapefruit, lemon, orange, pineapple and melon. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Nicely dry but still juicy to finish, very well balanced, lots more grapefruit and orange. Absolutely wonderful beer.

On tap at Hill Farmstead third anniversary. Pours a pale hazy golden with thick creamy head. Aroma is tropical fruits and citrus, flowers and dank resin. Taste is very fruity, moderatly hoppy with a little more malt than I could expect from HF that makes it dangerously drinkable. Very good.

Draft at Hills 3rd Anniversary ! Pours a cloudy peach color with a finger of sticky foam. Lots of tropical notes, mango, pineapple some dank herb and honeyed malt profile. A touch thin on the palate with the flavors dropping of pretty abruptly leaving a earthy field-like finish.

on tap at hill farmsteads 3rd anniversary. pours hazy pale and glowing yellow with a creamy white head, good retention and lacing. loads of citra without its often harshness, some tropical and citrus, lemon, grass, hay and wheat, hint of acidity and sweetness, ginger. average carbonation, light body - some texture, very nice citrusy short but oh so enjoyable finish. would drink everyday.. excellent brew! highlight of the festival, for me it was.

On tap @ Hill Farmstead 3rd Anniversary. Hazy golden/orange with a huge white head and intense lacing. Aroma is of citrus and tropical fruits (orange, mango, tangerine) along with light sweetness notes and herbal notes. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet and is almost the same as aroma... citrus and tropical fruits burst. Smooth bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Theres nothing outstanding in there, but its so well executed, well balanced and sessionable that its without a doubt a great APA/IPA. Another winner from HF.

Pours a cloudy golden with white head and good lacing. Aroma of mangos, pineapple, grapefruits. Taste is full on tropical fruits with just enough malts to make it well balanced. Low to medium body and medium carb. Very enjoyable. Summer in a glass

2013-04-26. Lightly hazy pale orange body modest off white head and lace. 3++ Aroma is quite nice, light yeasty pithy. Orange and tangerine, light yeast around the edges? Flavour is similar, modest bitterness throughout, orange and tangerine have more pithy quality and a hint of cattiness around the edges. 7+ Average palate suits it. Solid. On tap at Prohibition Pig, Waterbury

Bouteille réutilisable 750ml avec  swing-top achetée au fût sur place à Greensboro. Une belle trouvaille signée slovaksniper. Bue le jour même à Longueuil. Liquide jaune avec une mousse collante sur les parois. Le nez est tout en citron, en fruits tropicaux et avec ses malts discrets. En bouche le liquide se déploie avec envergure. Le nez ne mentait pas, il y a des fruits tropicaux, des agrumes et du citron dans cette bière. Un classique de Hill7+

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2014 On tap at the brewery (followed by a 750ml growler a few days later).  Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma strong of citrusy hops, a good amount of pale and light caramel/honey from the malts, and a little dough/yeastiness typical of the HF beers.  Flavor incredible for a pale ale.  Smooth texture.  A great beer for the style.

Edit: 2L growler in a tulip.  Aroma of citra hops, pale malts, and light dough.  Flavor highlights the citra hops very well.  Great texture.  Another great HF beer.

Un growler de 75 cl partagé avec rodenbach99.  Une bière orangée.  Une dentelle comme le souvenir de sa belle coiffe tenace.  Au nez, des parfums de pamplemousse et dananas  avec une touche féline et linconditionnelle base maltée de la maison qui propose une fantomatique action sucrée.  Sur les papilles, le houblon est frais, rempli de zestes dagrumes et dherbes piquantes.  Le niveau damertume est superbement maîtrisé.  Une belle attaque qui nest jamais violente.  Des malts pâles qui jouent le beau rôle dans cette montée houblonnée.  En bouche, un corps fabriqué pour les grandes lampées.  En finale, une empreinte de pils doublée par les saveurs asséchantes du Citra.  Une autre solide proposition de Hill Farmstead.  Rien de spectaculairement impressionnant  tant dans les arômes que dans les saveurs.  Ceci dit, une bière sans faute qui est excessivement facile à boire.

Pours a opaque yellow orange... Looks similar to all Shauns beers. Nice pillowy white head with decent lacing. Smells of tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, and citrus fruits. Taste follows although its not as "juicy" as I would expect. Subtle dry bitter finish... Really great single hop brew.

Pours a hazy golden honey color with a thick creamy white head...nice lacing and retention.  Aroma has notes of grass, herbs, citrus rind, and orange tea...very fresh and floral.  Flavor has nice grass and citrus rind...just a touch of herbal notes...very fresh and floral tasting.  Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is dry and bitter with grassy tea and citrus rind.  Awesome beer!
Jaune paille, voilée avec une faible mousse. Nez tropical incroyable. Un peu mince en bouche, mais ultra-fruitée avec une amertume à la fois franche et douce en finale.

Growler de 1.8 L, merci beaucoup à David et Catherine. Arômes très intenses de houblons floraux et fruités (surtout du pamplemousse rose). Très légère pointe de litière à chat. Robe blonde et trouble, effervescence moyenne et belle petite mousse. En bouche, le houblon floral et fruité (abricots, mais surtout agrumes) se montre très frais. Le corps est svelte et croustillant, mais on retrouve de très belles notes céréalières. Finale moyennement amère et plutôt sèche. Une autre excellente pale ale de Hill Farmstead.

Swing-top growler at home with my dad. Huge thanks to Frank for this one!! Pour is that same hazy orange-gold color, so many of Shauns APA/IPAs have; big fluffy white head and great lacing. Ganja, grapefruity, light pineapples, some mango, straw, fruit peel, and grass in the aroma. Taste is just potent juicy hoppiness - oranges grapefruits, citrus,  somewhat weedy, and grassy - clean malt body with light touches of biscuit and straw and a big bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. I still cant believe the body Shaun gets on these 5% pale ales, its pretty amazing.

Dégustée en fût au Farmhouse Tap & Grill à Burlington, VT. De couleur jaune-dorée et voilée. Nez de houblon fruité citrique (agrumes sucrées,  léger de pamplemousse) et aux notes florales et herbeuses, moyen de céréales fraîches avec des notes de pain et de levures. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux notes huileuses et crémeuses.  Goût moyennement amer de houblon fruité et citrique (agrumes, notes de pamplemousse, traces de pêches et de fruits tropicaux) avec des notes de levures épicées (poivre doux) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de céréales fraîches et légèrement sucrées ainsi que des notes de pain puis en finale lamertume de houblon se fait plus herbeuse (herbes fraîches). Post-goût moyen-long et aux notes sèches, moyennement amer de houblon fruité,  moyennement herbeux et citrique avec des traces de céréales.  (3 avril 2013)
Sample at the brewery. Pours a clean shiny gold with gentile lacing. Nice touch of pineapple to go with a slight but rounded sting of pine. Gentile, balanced, and quite good.

Growler shared three ways.

Pours a murky golden orange color with a bubbly off white head and average streaks of lacing. Aroma is powerfully dank and resiny, overwhelmed by the citra hops and unsurprisingly not much else. Flavor is mildly sweet with a strong malt body hiding behind abundant citra hops, bitter and citric. Crisp medium bodied with moderate carbonation, this is a very drinkable single hop APA/IPA. Lacking any complexity or depth of an exceptional IPA to get too excited about, but for what it is, very enjoyable.

I had this at the Cigar City tasting room, and I was quite impressed.  It definitely lived up the the hype around the brewery... now if only we could get more of it...

From notes - full pint pour of hazed deep straw color with a full finger of fluffy white head.  Nose was beautiful, juicy hops, floral notes all over, bitter grapefruit and citrus following.  Flavor follows suit and gets better, with citrus juiciness front to back, bitter hops, grapefruit, fresh citrus, fresh cut grass, crisp all the way with faint notes of malt in the back.  Light/Medium body with light lacing.

In short: A cushiony and highly aromatic blonde IPA bursting with refreshing tropical and exotic fruits.  Great beer
How: Tap, fresh directly at the brewery
The look: Cloudy murky blonde body topped by a small white head leaving lots of lacings on the glass
In long: The highly aromatic nose has some of the typical (to me) cat urine smell that characterises most Citra IPA, but there is also quite a lot of tropical fruits.  Body has a very similar (if not identical) malt backbone to most Hill Farmstead Pale Ale, .this mean a nice bready (baguette) and crackery malt bill with a cushiony mouthfeel and a low sweetness sensation.  The hops bombards the palate with refreshing fruity flavors and aromas but the bitterness remains smooth and round and of medium intensity.  This is truly a wonderful session IPA, never aggressigopve, full of flavors but never too intense.  I actually preferred it over its bigger sister HF Double Citra.  Can a man have a G-Spot?  Because I think mine is at Hill Farmstead.

pour is hazy dark orange with light sediment floating around and a white head with some loose bubbles on top. The hops are quite strong, it gives it a tropical fruit aroma with grapefruit and pineapple notes. There is an accompanying dough malt playing around underneath but subtle.  The flavor is more balanced, the Malta are grainy with a light doughiness. The hops are assertively tropical, grapefruit and pineapple, with an assertive bitterness, dry finish, and clean light to medium body. Overall, another good beer from hill farmstead. Good balance, different malt components, interesting focus on the citra hop, extremely bright for a lower abv beer.

Growler shared by Thorpe429 and Amyliz4. Thanks Mike and Amy! Served alongside FFF Cenotaph.

A: Hazy and orange, with about an inch of white head that leaves some good lacing on the pint glass.

S: Nice bouquet of citrus and hops.

T: Delicious. Not quite as hop forward as the Cenotaph, but perhaps smoother and easier drinking. Wonderful aroma and flavor coming from the Citra hops.

M: Medium body, very smooth with a nice carbonation level.

D: A great IPA. Id happily drink this again.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 01-06-2011

On draft at Cigar City, poured a light yellow color, aromas of fresh tropical fruits with some light malt thrown in.  Flavors are the same with some citrus starting off, tropical fruit and light malt follow, nice and refreshing beer overall.

On Tap at Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover at Positive Pie in Plainfield.

A - Straw hay appearance. 2 finger solid white head faded to a small ring of head lacing. Very cloudy. Looks like Double Citra..not sure why :)

S - Smells of faint grapefruits and orange peels. Very high zesty content. Bananas?

T - Taste is same as the scent. Loving the citrus notes but theres also a grassy under-taste to this beer.

M - Solid carb, medium body. Enjoyable. 

O - Compared side by side with Double Citra, I prefer double. Im a citra head so Id rather go all of the way but its very easy to drink and goes really well with pieyes seriously.
Had this on draft at the brewery.  Really crisp and refreshing pale ale.  High bitterness and nice citrus fruit and scallion flavors.  Quaffable and flavorful.

Pours a hazy pale gold. Aroma of dank citra hops. Taste follows, bitter but with a nice malt backbone. Beats zombie dust!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler... Hazy straw-colored ale with a small, fizzy, white head. Decent retention. The bouquet is of tropical fruit  guava and mango - citrusy hops and apricot. Light-bodied with lively carbonation. The flavor is well-balanced and lemony up front; then, theres light bitterness intertwined with bready-malt sweetness. Finishes crisp with a lemon peel aftertaste. Growler courtesy of landhoney!

Growler from the brewery...Hazy golden pour, two finger white head, excellent lacing. Aroma of tropical fruit,lemon and caramel. Excellent hop flavor, tangerine,grass,melon and some pine.Light bodied,soft carbonation.Finish is dry with a lingering hop bitterness. Excellent

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2012 Draft at the brewery and growler at home.   Super hazy orange with a thick, spitty chalk-white head. Lots of tropical fruits, citrus, pine, light caramel backbone.  Big, floral, citrusy hop flavor with no brash bitterness at all.  Big bitterness, yet it doesnt leave the tongue feeling tortured.  This is quite a pale ale. Earlier Rating: 7/1/2010 Total Score: 4.5Shenandoah Throwdown, growler, thanks peregrinari.   I really loved this beer.  We had it side by side with some fresh pliny and to me, it blew the pliny away.  Ultra dankity dank, tropical fruits, citrus, and still very dry.  Great balance.  This is the brewery to watch for 2010.  Shaun Hill, thank you for bringing the east coast another high class brewery.
Tap. Cloudy golden with an averaged sized head. Fruity, citrus, piney, floral and just all around nice hoppiness. Some lighter caramel in the tastes.

On tap at Teresas.  Cloudy peach brown with a white head.  Nose is tangerine, toffee, cat and grass.  Medium light with a muted tingle.  Taste is lemon peel, grapefruit peel, scallion, in a good way, and toffee. Solid starter paired with deep-fried mac and cheese topped with BBQ pork and a side of slaw.Earlier Rating: 1/7/2011 Total Score: 3.8On tap at Capones.  Foggy orange brown with a thin but persistent head.  Nose is toffee, cat pee, grass and grapefruit.  Resiny medium light with soft carb.  Taste is pink grapefruit, pith and lemon peel with a hint of honey.  Pretty straightforward for what it is but still crisp and clean.

Draft at Tria Fermentation.  Poured a cloudy golden orange with a thin white head.  Huge citrus aroma inluding hints of tangerine and pineapple followed by notes of floral and pine.  Very well- balanced flavor of citrus and palatable hop bitterness with an extremely smooth finish.  Big aroma and flavor profile, yet so drinkable.

Courtesy of sarro 
Bottle: The aroma consists of big citrus, grapefruit, some pot, and tropical fruits. It pours a hazy dull golden-orange with a small white head. The flavor starts with some tropical fruits and orange. The finish has some light-moderate grapefruit. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and a soft mouthfeel. Overall...I could drink this all day.

On tap, pours a cloudy orange with small head, excellent lace. Aromas of melon, tropical citra. Taste is the most cantalope tasting ipa I have encountered, pineapple, peach, onions, all kinds of tropical notes, vanilla, and apricot. This is so sessionable and tasty that its scary. Finishes with a perfect bitterness, and orange pine flavor. Perfectly balanced and expertly crafted.

Tap at hf anniver. Party.   Aroma of dank, resiny hop bitterness.  Pine needles.  Hop forward, abrasive resiny hop bite that lingers on the pallet.  Some dry rustic grass.   Dry.  Nice, tasty beer.   Prefer a bit more balance,   a touch too bitter.

On tap at the brewery. pours a hazy orange color with a soapy head. smell is strong citrus with a clean malt character. taste is citrus and piney hops with a clean malt flavor. bitterness is moderate leaving a dry feeling. overall dry leaving you wanting more.
On draft at the hill farmstead anniversary party. Huge tropical pineapple notes. Nice mild finish, there is some glaring clarity with these pale ales. Love it!!

On tap at the Hill Farmstead 2nd Anniversary party. Hazy orange-gold pour with a lively white frothy head. The nose has all the qualities I know and love from citra- juicy nectar fruits, tropical fruits, and citrus fruits. Big mango and papya lead to mandarin, apricot, orange peel, and peach. Hints of herbal dankness in the background. Medium body with pillowy caressing effervescence and a crisp citrusy finish. Another masterful single hop creation. In terms of single hop IPAs from Hill Farmstead, this and Summit are some of my personal favorites.

Flip top growler from joeybones3.  Thanks, man!  This pours a hazy golden color with a thin white head.  Big tropical fruit aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, and mango.  Some caramel eventually sneaks in there for the malt presence.  Quite floral and tropical fruity tasting, with fresh-cut grass mixing in, along with some bitter citrus peel.  Dry and clean in the finish.  Hoppy but not incredibly bitter.  With the relatively low abv this is extremely refreshing and drinkable.  A very good beer that probably just stops short of being amazing.

(Draught)  Pours a cloudy orange body with a small white head.  Aroma of florals, citrus, pine, and caramel.  Flavor of grass, citrus, caramel, nectarine, and florals with a dry, bitter finish.  Excellent.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 Served on-tap at Capones into a sampler glass.


A - Pours cloudy, murky, orange with a nice pillowy one finger white head leaving sticky spots of lacing down the glass.


S - Now we are talking! I let this baby sit for over an hour and it still had a HUGE citric hop punch up front, so damn intoxicating. Lots of grapefruit and other tropical fruits meld well with the sweet caramel malt. A simply amazing nose on this one.


T - Lots of strong grapefruit, from the hops, up front giving way quickly to a mix of sweet caramel malt and strong citric hops. Finish is caramel sweet with some lingering bitterness from the hops and dryness from the yeast. There is no doubt in my mind that I am a sucker for citra hops. This has been one of the best citra hop IPAs I have had to date.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Feel is very nice with plenty of bitter hops. Finish is bitter with a bit of dryness. Nothing too mind blowing in this department.


D - Very high. I think I could literally drink this all day. One of the best smelling IPAs I have had in quite some time. The taste was a bit of a letdown but it was still very good. I really enjoyed this one quite a bit. Excellent stuff for sure.
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2011  Pours orange. Lightly cloudy. White head. Nose and taste of apricot, citrus, pineapple and caramel malt. Taste also has a light pine finish. Solid mouth feel.

Hazed orange pour with watery white head. Huge citrus and caramel malt. Huge citrus, light sweet caramel in the middle with a huge resiny bitter finish. A hint of orange as well. Medium bodied with good carbonation.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2011 Growler, Summer 2010. Fat and sticky, dank hop nose, mounds of citrus and pine, some caramel. The taste is lightly sweet, moderately bitter, lots of grapefruit, pine and cotton candy. Very nice!! Love this brewery!

On tap at the Blackback Pub & Flyshop on November 4, 2010. Served in a pint glass.

Pours a bright orange color with a two-finger bone-white head and a pretty good amount of lacing. The nose is really, really bright with tons of fresh hops and loads of citrus as well as some tropical notes. A lot of orange, tangerine, and a bit of mango and some other tropical notes. The taste is really fantastic with citric and tropical notes going on overload, with the mouthfeel providing a really excellent amount of bitterness to complement the beers hop flavors. Drinks incredibly well and I could have kept on going with these all night.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

Hazy/cloudy amber pour.  The aroma is pure hop awesomeness.  Bright lemon peel, hop resin and pine cones.  Lean-bodied but with a kiss of light biscuit malt on the back.  Dry hoppy finish.  Lingering resin and some piny finish.  Man - this is damn good stuff.

Thanks to Kan for this growler. Ill echo Seans comments that according to Alex who had a growler a week earlier this batch of Citra was on its way down, would love to get some fresh...Pours a dark orange, notes of brown, light tan head, decent head and lacing...The aroma is malt forward, especially for a citra, lots of caramel. Good strategy for this style. The citra hops are still there, just not in your face, tons of citrus fruits, oranges and grapefruits...The taste is right on the nose, a malty citra beer, caramel mixed with citrus. Makes this more drinkable for me as I am not a fan of the in your face citras. Would like to try it fresher, hopefully it doesnt become a citra bomb.

On draft at Capones.  Pours a hazy orange gold with a medium sized white head.  Aroma of sweet citrus, grapefruit, citra hops and pine notes.  Taste is much the same as the aroma.  A bit on the watery side.

Draft at Capones.  Pours deep copper toward brown with minimal head.  Nose is heavy caramel malt, brown sugar, mango, earthy hops.  Tastes citric, caramel malty, with that great assertive citra hop flavor.  Nice balance and a great beer.

Draft at Capones (PA)  5 oz glass... Pours a hazy orage, small head. Great aroma of orange, grapefruit and other fruits. Taste is a nice simple IPA. Fruity but a strong bitterness in the after taste. Lots of taste for a 5 percent beer. Body was on the thinner side.  Overall nice IPA.

Draught at Capones:  Aroma of citra hops, grapefruit, lots of pine, nectarine, evergreen, tropical fruit and citrus.  Poured orange/amber in color with a small creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Not sparkling.  Opaque.  Excellent lacing.  Flavor is heavily bitter and lightly sweet.  Tastes of hops, pine, grapefruit, tropical fruit, Citra, citrus, and evergreen.  Medium body.  Dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Heavily bitter, lightly sweet, hop, Citra, grapefruit, pine, light tropical fruit finish is dry.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2013 Hill farmstead citra ipa. Growler from somehwere out east... Pours a  
medium apple cider brown, somewhat murky, with a thin soapy white  
head... Aroma of citrus and orange tangerine like with an herbal  
tea-like presence... Herbal tea and citrus like overall with not as  
pungent of a fruity nature. Light to medium carbonation. Decent overall.  Must try again with a fresher sample.  Now how do i go about getting one?!
8/4/7/4/15
Super fresh sample sent to me by ft, thanks buddy.  Pour is more glowing in nature this time around with lots of juicy citrus shining in the aroma. A touch of cattiness as well with a touch of aspirin and crackery pale grains.  A light bitterness on the backend.  Flavors more of the same with a citrusy bittersweet focus while a mild grassy bitterness exerts itself on the backen.  Clean, quaffable, and well executed. Providing an extra point this time around but doesnt quite reach the enjoyment level of friendship but Id gladly drink this any day of the week.
8/4/8/4/15

Pours a very dark, golden burnt orange color with golden yellowish-orange hues when held to a light source. Very hazy and almost completely opaque with a one finger foamy off-white head that slowly fades into a lasting ring. Sporadic chunks of soapy lacing left behind.

Sweet citrus hop aroma with lots of citrus and tropical fruit notes. Hints of pineapple, lemon peel and grapefruit are accompanied by some dank earthy pine needle notes. Caramel malt presence in the nose as well with hints of biscuit and graham cracker. The hops smell uber fresh but the malt presence cuts this down a bit. It kind of smells like a tamer cousin of a WCIPA.

Chewy full body for the style with lots of dank, fresh hop bitterness up front that lingers throughout over the sweet citrus/tropical fruit notes and malt backbone into a crisp, dry finish. Although the flavor is dominated by hops, the hop flavors are very well balanced. The palate starts off with very dry earthy piny bitterness which is quickly countered by an excellent sweet citrus flavor. Hints of mango and pineapple as well as some grapefruit and citrus peel. All of this is also nicely balanced by the caramel/graham cracker/biscuit malt backbone. A bit too malty compared to some other beers in the WCIPA style but still plenty hoppy and extremely quaffable. Recommended!
Pours a lovely orange huge with a nice white head. Aroma of grapefruit and hoppy goodness. Taste is well balanced with ample hop body, citrus and resin. Nice dry, clean finish.

Amber pour from a keg at a tasting.  Thanks Keith! 
Aroma is Huge fruit, ruby red grapefruit, some blood orange with underlying bitterness and some light caramel malt that takes a nice backseat.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Flavor is again a fruity explosion with a bitter backbone.  Perfection in a Citra IPA.  The Best Ive had.
Greasy and resinous citra hop flavor.  Possibly one of the best IPAs iv e had.  Cant wait to try more Hill F brews!
Huge, fruity, grapefruit aroma.  Flavor, comparatively, is quite surprisingly dry; more big citrus - like grapefruit zest.

On tap at the Three Penny Tap Room - Pours a beautiful orange amber in color with a small off white head.  Aroma was BIG with fruity and citrus/grapefruit hops and just a hint of malt/caramel underneath.  Flavor followed pretty closely... the hops were even bitter and more citrus than they smelled.  This is a masterful single hop brew... I have had few (none?) better.

This is yet another world class piece of work by Shaun Hill.  The laser like precision of the flavors in all of his beers is truly unique.  He accomplishes this with highly attenuated, dryness that is risky because there isnt a bunch of junk to sort through, ie, a flaw in the brewiung process would show through like a third nipple on a beauty contestant.  It is much more difficult to make a beer like this.  The floral and fruity complexity is dizzying but he isnt hiding behind a thrwo everything in the kettle approach and say wow, thats a big "craft" beer IPA.  Bravo.

Aroma right away is nice and juicy. Tropical and pine hops with tons of citrus and grapefruit. Really tasty. Flavor is smooth sweet, tropical hoppy goodness. Not overly bitter and finishes clean. Nice.

Shenandoah Throwdown, growler, thanks peregrinari.  Hazy amber body with small white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit/pine, orange, nectarine, light lemon.  Taste is medium sweet, grapefruit/pine, tangerine/orange, light nectarine.  Medium body, low carbonation, light acidity, resin.

Apperance: Orange/yellowish with a mediumsized, white, head.

Aroma: Caramel, Citric notes, Exotic fruit with a hint of white bread.

Taste: Citric notes, Exotic fruit, Melon, Caramel and a hint of pine.

Palate: Clean and crisp ipa, perfectly balanced and refreshing showing
what one can do with the citra hops. Were talking drinkability++ here.

My favourite brew by far from this small microbrewery in the middle of nowhere.
Hazy orange-yellow pour with a white head.  Lots of grapefruit, basil and citrus.  Dry hop flavor with some grass.  Herbs, basil, citrus, and grapefruit.  Excellent IPA.

Orange, lemon, melon fruity and herbal hops in the very fresh, clean and inviting aroma.  Clear golden body is topped by a decent, fine bubbled, white head that lasts well and leaves some spotty lacing.  Fruity flavours in the nose are also notable in the flavour and combine well with sweet, clean toasted malts.  Some earthy notes are also apparent.  Bitterness though pronounced, is quite clean and lingers well.  Medium body with wonderful effervescence.  Easily my favourite of the four beers sampled.  It had such a refreshing and appealing sunny day taste.  I could happily drink this on a hot summer afternoon to beat the humidity.  Sampled on tap at the brewery.

Pours a hazy golden orange with a medium bubbly white head.  Aroma of floral hops, grapefruit, mango and a touch of caramel.  Flavor of grapefruit, nice smooth hop bitterness, some light caramel and bready malt.  Great showcase of Citra hops.

Pouring at the opening of Hill Farmstead.  Pours a hazy orange gold with a medium sized white head.  Musk melon, citrus, really nice.  Medium bodied, smooth with some earthy malt, light citrus.  Smooth grapefruit on the finish, long and soft.

[Draft @ brewery] Orange color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of tropical fruits, melon, tangerine, citrus, pine, and floral hoppiness.  Taste of citrus, orange, melon, some grass, pine, and a fair amount of bitterness in the finish.  Lots of fruit in this hop.
